result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan T. Mortenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine and costs are due as follows: $50.00 is due on or before 12/01/2022 and then $50.00 is due by the first of the month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid or a civil judgment entered for collection purposes. 

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan T. Mortenson

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Defendant Nathan T. Mortenson in court.  Attorney Stephanie K. Osborne in court for Nathan T. Mortenson.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim rights issues. Defendant enters a plea of Guilty.
 Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his/her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Retail Theft-Intentionally Take (1) contrary to 943.50(1m)(b) and 939.05 - Party to a Crime (1). Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation:  Pay upfront restitution of $482.88, paid $509.44 Oct 7th. Court Costs. 

Court adopts joint recommendation: Restitution ordered, defendant has previously been paid in full - $482.88 plus statutory costs. Orders $50.00 fine and costs totaling $526.00. Pay @ $50.00 per month starting 12/1/2022, pay each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid or civil judgment entered for collection purposes. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.

Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.
8/15/22 STC canceled and being scheduled for PLEAS per request of Attorney Stephanie Osborne; ok'd with DA's office. CLO
